alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 5:36PM MDT until July 24 at 9:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central El Paso County in east central Colorado... * Until 930 PM MDT. * At 536 PM MDT, Trained weather spotters reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain and localized flash flooding in eastern parts of the Colorado Springs area. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported flash flooding in eastern portions of the Colorado Springs area. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Colorado Springs, Fountain, Peterson AFB, Cimarron Hills, Security, Security-Widefield, Stratmoor, Fort Carson and Falcon. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
